sentences.english: Two suspicious-looking fellows were seen hanging around the campus .
sentences.chinese: 昨夜有人看见两个形迹可疑的人在校园徘徊。

sentences.english: That man looks suspicious; keep an eye on him.
Had they no apprehension of any thing before the elopement took place?
sentences.chinese: 他们俩私奔之前，难道看不出一点形迹可疑的地方吗？

sentences.english: She often mouths off to the wrong person, or follows someone who looks shady.
sentences.chinese: 她总是对不该发火的人发火，还老跟踪形迹可疑的人。

sentences.english: Thee suspicious-looking man drove up to the border, where he was greeted by a sentry.
sentences.chinese: 一个形迹可疑的人开车来到边境，哨兵迎了上去。

sentences.english: Videos from a camera lowered into the coal mine showed no signs of the missing men.
sentences.chinese: 矿井调查获取的录像显示不出任何失踪矿工的形迹。

sentences.english: Some suspicious-looking men were loitering about near the house.
sentences.chinese: 有几个形迹可疑的人在屋子附近荡来荡去。

sentences.english: Then one night, the suspicious-looking fellow happened to stop by for a drink.
sentences.chinese: 有天晚上，那个形迹可疑的人碰巧到哪里喝酒。

sentences.english: Two suspicious-looking fellows were seen hanging around the campus last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜有人看见两个形迹可疑的人在校园里逡巡。

sentences.english: 1The suspicious-looking man drove up to the border, where he was greeted by a sentry.
sentences.chinese: 1一个形迹可疑的人开车来到边境，哨兵迎了上去。

sentences.english: There's a suspicious-looking man outside the house; I've had my eye on him for some time.
sentences.chinese: 门外有个形迹可疑的人，我已注意他好一会儿了。

sentences.english: The suspicious-looking man drove up to the border, where he was greeted by a sentry.
sentences.chinese: 一个形迹可疑的人开车来到边境，哨兵迎了上去。

sentences.english: It was the spy's suspicious manner that first put us on to him.
sentences.chinese: 最初引起我们警惕的是这个间谍可疑的形迹。

sentences.english: She looked around this way and that in a dubious manner.
sentences.chinese: 她在路上东张西望的，形迹十分可疑。

sentences.english: Two suspicious-looking fellows were seen hanging around the campus last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜有人看见两个形迹可疑的人在校园里徘徊。

sentences.english: Geologic evidence shows that most faults have had repeated movement on them.
sentences.chinese: 地质形迹表明，大多数断层有反复运动。

definition: to hide/to conceal and avoid (contact)/to keep sth concealed
eyes and ears/sb's attention or notice/information/knowledge/spies
sth one wishes to conceal/the cat (as in "let the cat out of the bag")
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and leave without a trace
